page.title: 02RODMARTON MANOR
page.content: Rodmarton Manor and adjoining grounds cover 7 acres. The house has eight principal rooms and a private chapel. The gardens are open to the public 26 times a year and the house 6 times. The house was built between 1909-1926 by local craftsmen. The furniture is all hand made. The present owner has been there 30 years and now lives alone. There are 6 tenants in adjoining flats. Water comes from a 400 ft well. The same supply is pumped to Rodmarton & Culkerton. There is mains electricity and bottled gas. There are open wood fires and central heating. 2 are employed part time in the house, 4 full time in the garden. Roses, peonies, hostas, snowdrops, helibores and wistaria grow well. There is a swimming pool in the grounds.
